recipes.title: Cheese Dosa
ingredients: ½ cup grated cheese (cheddar or mozzarella)
steps: Heat a non-stick pan or tawa and grease lightly with oil/butter.
Pour a ladle of dosa batter and spread it in a thin circle.
Sprinkle chopped onion, chili, coriander, and salt on top.
Add grated cheese evenly over the dosa.
Drizzle a little oil/butter around the edges and cook on medium heat until golden and crisp.
Fold the dosa and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

recipes.title: Chicken Biryani
steps: Soak rice for 30 minutes.
Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, and ginger garlic paste for 1 hour.
Fry onions until golden. Set aside half.
Cook marinated chicken with tomatoes.
Boil rice with whole spices until 70% done.
Layer rice over chicken. Top with fried onions, mint, and coriander.
Cook on low heat (dum) for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Chocolate Mug Cake
steps: Mix dry ingredients in a microwave-safe mug.
Add milk, oil, and vanilla. Mix until smooth.
Microwave for 1.5–2 minutes.
Let it cool slightly and enjoy!

recipes.title: Chocolate Brownie
ingredients: Optional: 1/2 cup chopped walnuts or chocolate chips
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease or line a square baking pan (8x8 or 9x9 inch).
Melt butter and let it cool slightly.
In a bowl, whisk together butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, beat until smooth.
Sift in cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder. Mix gently—don’t overmix.
Fold in nuts or chocolate chips if using.
Pour batter into prepared pan, spread evenly.
Bake for 25–30 minutes until a toothpick comes out with moist crumbs (not dry).
Cool completely before cutting into squares.
Serve plain or with a scoop of vanilla ice cream

recipes.title: Gulab Jamun
steps: Mix milk powder, maida, baking soda, and ghee. Add milk slowly to make a soft dough.
Divide into small smooth balls.
Heat oil/ghee on low flame and fry balls until golden brown.
In a pan, prepare syrup by boiling sugar, water, and cardamom for 10 mins.
Soak fried balls in hot syrup for at least 1 hour before serving.

recipes.title: Kheer (Rice Pudding)
steps: Boil milk in a heavy pan. Add soaked rice and simmer on low heat.
Stir occasionally until rice becomes soft and mixture thickens.
Add sugar, cardamom, dry fruits, and saffron.
Cook for another 10 mins.
Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.title: Kulfi
steps: Boil milk in a pan and reduce to half while stirring.
Add sugar, condensed milk, milk powder, cardamom, saffron, and nuts. Mix well.
Simmer 10 mins until thick.
Pour into kulfi molds or small cups.
Freeze for 6–8 hours. Unmold and serve.

recipes.title: Jalebi
steps: Make a smooth batter with maida, cornflour, yogurt, baking powder, and water. Ferment 6–8 hours.
Prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar, water, saffron, and cardamom until sticky.
Fill batter in a piping bag or squeeze bottle.
Pipe spirals into hot oil and fry until golden.
Dip immediately in warm sugar syrup for 1–2 mins and serve.

recipes.title: Masala Dosa
steps: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chili.
Add sliced onion and ginger. Sauté until soft.
Add turmeric and mashed potatoes. Mix well with salt. Cook for 2–3 mins. Set aside (this is the masala filling).
Heat a dosa tawa/pan. Pour a ladle of batter and spread thin in a circular motion.
Drizzle a little oil or ghee around the edges. Cook until crisp and golden.
Place the prepared potato masala in the center, fold the dosa, and serve hot with chutney & sambar.

recipes.title: Rava Dosa
steps: In a mixing bowl, combine rava, rice flour, and maida.
Add chopped onion, chili, ginger, coriander, curry leaves, cumin, and salt.
Mix with water to form a thin, watery batter (consistency like buttermilk). Rest 15 mins.
Heat a dosa tawa/pan. Pour the batter from the edges to the center (do not spread).
Drizzle oil around edges and cook on medium heat until crisp and golden.
Flip if needed, or serve directly with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.title: Onion Dosa
steps: Heat a dosa tawa/pan and lightly grease it with oil.
Pour a ladleful of dosa batter and spread it evenly in a thin circle.
Immediately sprinkle chopped onion, green chili, coriander, and cumin seeds on top.
Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges and cook on medium heat until crisp and golden.
Flip if desired, or fold directly. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.title: Paneer Dosa
steps: Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan. Add onion, green chili, and ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until golden.
Add tomato, turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until tomatoes soften.
Add paneer cubes and mix well. Cook for 2–3 mins. Garnish with coriander. (This is the paneer masala filling.)
Heat dosa tawa/pan, pour a ladle of dosa batter, and spread thin.
Drizzle oil/ghee around edges and cook until crisp.
Place the paneer masala filling in the center, fold the dosa, and serve hot with chutney & sambar.

recipes.title: Masala Omelette
steps: Crack eggs into a bowl and beat well.
Add chopped onion, chili, coriander, salt, and pepper. Mix.
Heat oil in a pan.
Pour the egg mixture and cook on low heat until golden.
Flip and cook the other side. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Grilled Salmon with Lemon Butter Sauce
steps: Pat dry the salmon fillets and season with salt and black pepper.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Place salmon skin-side down and cook for 4–5 minutes until golden.
Flip and cook the other side for another 3–4 minutes until salmon is cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, melt butter. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add lemon juice and zest, stir well to make the sauce.
Pour the lemon butter sauce over the grilled salmon.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot with lemon slices.

recipes.title: Bengali Fish Curry
steps: Clean the fish pieces and marinate with salt and turmeric. Set aside for 10 minutes.
Heat mustard oil in a pan until it smokes lightly. Shallow fry the fish pieces until golden. Remove and keep aside.
In the same oil, add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, green chilies, and cook until soft.
Add turmeric, red chili, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well.
Pour water (as per desired gravy consistency) and bring to a boil.
Gently add fried fish pieces into the curry and simmer for 8–10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Crispy Fish Fry
steps: Clean and pat dry the fish fillets.
Marinate with lemon juice, turmeric, red chili powder, ginger-garlic paste, and salt. Set aside for 15 minutes.
Mix cornflour and rice flour in a bowl. Coat each fish fillet evenly with the flour mixture.
Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat.
Fry the coated fish pieces until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Remove and place on paper towels to drain excess oil.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and chutney or ketchup.

recipes.title: Steamed Fish with Ginger Soy Glaze
ingredients: 2 whole fish fillets (tilapia, sea bass, or snapper)
steps: Clean and pat dry the fish fillets. Lightly season with salt.
Place the fish on a heatproof plate that fits inside a steamer.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar to make the glaze.
Spread ginger, garlic, and chili slices over the fish.
Pour half of the soy glaze mixture on top of the fish.
Place the plate inside a steamer (or a large pot with a steaming rack). Steam for 12–15 minutes until fish is tender and flakes easily.
Remove from steamer, drizzle remaining glaze over the fish.
Garnish with spring onions and fresh coriander leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Fish Biryani
ingredients: 500g fish pieces (preferably rohu, kingfish, or salmon)
Whole spices (2 bay leaves, 4 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick)
steps: Marinate the fish with turmeric, red chili powder, salt, and a little yogurt. Keep aside for 20 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, shallow fry the fish lightly and remove.
In the same oil, add whole spices, then sliced onions, and fry until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and green chilies. Cook until soft.
Mix in cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, and chili powders. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add yogurt, coriander leaves, and mint leaves. Stir well to make the masala base.
Gently place fried fish pieces into the masala. Simmer for 5 minutes.
In another pot, boil water with salt and cook soaked rice until 70% done. Drain water.
Layer rice and fish masala in a large heavy-bottomed pan. Sprinkle saffron milk (if using) on top.
Cover tightly and cook on low flame (dum) for 15–20 minutes.
Fluff gently and serve hot with raita or salad.

recipes.title: Vegetable Fried Rice
steps: Heat oil in a pan or wok on medium heat.
Add chopped onion and sauté until slightly golden.
Add carrot, peas, and capsicum. Stir-fry for 2–3 minutes on high flame.
Add cooked rice and mix gently.
Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, black pepper, and salt. Toss everything together.
Add chopped spring onion and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Serve hot with any curry or enjoy as is.

recipes.title: Pulao (Polao / Pilaf)
steps: Prepare the Rice:
Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 mins, then drain.
Cook the Chicken:
Heat oil + ghee in a pan.
Add whole spices (bay leaf, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, shah jeera).
Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, cook until raw smell goes.
Add chicken, yogurt, salt, turmeric, red chili, coriander, cumin powder.
Cook on medium heat until chicken is tender and oil separates.
Cook the Pulao:
Add soaked rice, stir gently with chicken.
Pour 4 cups warm water.
Add green chilies and garam masala powder.
Cover and cook on low heat until rice is fluffy and water is absorbed.
Finishing Touch:
Place boiled eggs on top (optional).
Rest for 10 mins before serving.

recipes.title: Lemon Rice
steps: Cook rice and let it cool (grains should remain separate).
Heat oil/ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add urad dal, dry red chilies, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until golden.
Add turmeric powder and salt, stir quickly.
Add cooked rice into the pan, mix gently to coat evenly.
Switch off the heat and pour fresh lemon juice. Mix well without breaking the rice grains.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve warm with pickle, papad, or curd.

recipes.title: Coconut Rice
steps: Cook rice and allow it to cool (grains should remain separate).
Heat oil/ghee in a pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add urad dal, dry red chilies, green chilies, curry leaves, and cashew nuts. Sauté until golden brown.
Add grated coconut and roast lightly for 2–3 minutes (don’t over-brown).
Add the cooked rice, sprinkle salt, and mix gently so the coconut blends well.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve warm with pickle, papad, or any curry.

recipes.title: Curd Rice
steps: Cook rice and allow it to cool slightly (grains should remain separate).
In a bowl, mix the rice with yogurt/curd. Add a little milk if you want a creamier texture.
Heat oil/ghee in a pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add urad dal, dry red chilies, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until golden brown.
Pour this tempering over the curd rice and mix gently.
Sprinkle salt and garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Serve chilled or at room temperature with pickle or papad.
